entry.title: Scheduling the secondary backup to be triggered on On-premises server
entry.content:
we want to schedule daily new full backup on on-premise server -->> they want to know how they can back their systems up to the on-premise storage from AWS.

 

"We have the setup of full backup and incremental backup scheduled from DB13 to hana database server filesystem daily, and it will then be moved to S3 bucket.

but now as per the audit requirement the full backup to be scheduled regularly from SAP/Hana to on-premise server and this backup should be able to have the restore successfully whenever needed. Need your help in understanding and scheduling the second backups to be trigged regularly without disturbing the present backup setup. 

Please help to provide the pre-requisites and steps to be followed to run the full backup on On-premises servers."

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: How to restrict access to view of supplier invoices in S4Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dears,

As it is in subject - How to restrict access to view of supplier invoices in S4Hana Public Cloud ?

For purpose:

Persons on B2B contract - they can't see each other's invoices in Supplier Invoice List app. 

Both person will be in the same Company Code, in the same Purchasing Group. Only difference will be in Cost Center.

How can we avoid this kind of situations ? 

Which attribute can limit this?

Regards

entry.title: System landscape directory on the specified remote server is outdated
entry.content:
Hi,
We are running CCC PL20H1 in our environment, and we have 2 Service Units :

1. Runs Hana - has ServiceLayer installed and registered in CCC
2. SQL - no ServiceLayer installed
I am trying to install a new ServiceLayer instance for the SQL SU but failing with "The version of the system landscape directory on the specified remote server is outdated. Before upgrading this computer, you must upgrade the system landscape directory on the remote machine."

 



Does anyone knows what might be the root cause?
Thank you

entry.title: Recommended Learning Journey for SAP Cloud Architecture?
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

I currently work in IT consulting, in the support area, but I‚Äôm looking to transition into the SAP ecosystem. I have a strong infrastructure background, with hands-on experience in Terraform, Docker, and AWS.

Recently, I completed a SAP BTP bootcamp, which sparked my interest in SAP Cloud Architecture, but I‚Äôm still a beginner when it comes to SAP solutions overall.

For those with more experience in this field:
Which Learning Journey or study path would you recommend for someone with my background who wants to dive into SAP Cloud Architecture?

I‚Äôm particularly interested in understanding the full landscape ‚Äî architecture, cloud integrations, and how SAP BTP fits within this environment.

Any tips, experiences, certifications, or useful resources would be highly appreciated! 

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

Thank you in advance for your support and suggestions! üôè

‚ÄîkadambalaSaikiran

entry.title: SAP Cloud Print Manager (CPM) and SAP RISE
entry.content:
Hello,
we have SAP RISE (hosted by SAP) and we want to print form RISE in our local Network.
I found the following article about CPM.
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/cloud-print-manager-for-pull-integration-installation-and-configuration/ba-p/13334437

There I found these sentence:
"The Cloud Print Manager for Pull Integration (CPM) was initially developed for SAP S/4HANA Public
Cloud systems. For On Premise systems, several adoptions were implemented (available in 2024), which will be described in SAP Note 3420465 - Print queues in on-premise systems. This note explain the differences between the Cloud / On Premise setup and there is document attached for enabling CPM in OnPrem Systems."

I would interpret this as follows: If you follow note 3420465, you can also use CPM in a RISE environment.

Is this correct?

We have several locations, each with their own printers.
Would it be possible to install a separate CPM at each location and connect it to RISE? In other words, connect 1-n CPMs to one RISE system (one for each location)?

Thanks

entry.title: Is there a S/4HANA cloud test/demo/development system for partners including sample data like IDES?
entry.content:
Hi folks,

This might be a noob question, but I cannot find an answer to it on the web and reaching out to SAP about only gives me e-mail after e-mail of links that I already found myself and that do not answer my question. So, maybe the community can help!?

Here is what I am looking for: we want to get access to a cloud based SAP ERP environment that allows us to develop a ABAP report and create a transport for it (SE38, SE93, SE10, SE80, STMS, ...). To be able to develop and test the program, the system needs to be prefilled with a "meaningful" amount of data in the MM and PP area, such as material master data, business partner master data, BOMs, sales orders, invoices, purchase orders, and so on. I do not have time to create all that data in a substantial amount myself. And we do not have a SAP system for migration or a data set that we could import. I formerly had access to an on-prem R/3 installation with the IDES (internet demonstration and evaluation system) data. Basically, we are looking for something similar, but a cloud-based offering with development rights. 2 or 3 named users would be sufficient. 

So the question is, is there such an offer by SAP and if so, where can I find it. Ohh, btw, we are SAP partners, so this can also be a partner offering.

Thank you
Thomas

entry.title: User ID for IAS users
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We provision users from Entra ID to IAS and then to cloud applications.

In the source system for Entra ID in IAS, we changed the default transformation code (user part):

Instead of:

 

 {
        "sourcePath": "$.userPrincipalName",
        "targetPath": "$.userName",
        "correlationAttribute": true
      },

we use:

{
  "sourcePath": "$.employeeId",
  "targetPath": "$.userName",
  "correlationAttribute": true
}

This way, the employee ID from Entra is provisioned to the Login Name field in IAS. When provisioning to the cloud application, a user is created with the employee ID as the user ID.

employeeId

Entra ID (employeeId) ‚Üí Login Name (IAS) ‚Üí User ID (SAC)

Problem:
Users created directly in IAS don‚Äôt have an employee ID, so the Login Name field in IAS is empty.

Question:
What can be used as the user ID in the cloud apps for users created directly in IAS?

 

Thank you very much for any tips

Best Regards

entry.title: What are the required steps to enable replication from SAP S/4HANA On-Premise to SAP MDG, cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to replicate Business Partners from SAP S/4HANA On-Premise to SAP MDG, cloud edition.

According to the Deep-Dive: SAP Master Data Governance, cloud edition documentation, this should be possible. However, the documentation only describes the configuration steps for SAP S/4HANA Cloud ‚Üí MDG Cloud (via Communication Arrangements) Create Communication Arrangement | SAP Help Portal.

So my question is: : What are the required steps to enable replication from SAP S/4HANA On-Premise to SAP MDG, cloud edition?

entry.title: how to start learning SAP - trainings, courses
entry.content:
Hi everybody, 

I‚Äôm new here and I have a question. I want to learn SAP and am new to this technology. Yes, I know it‚Äôs pretty tough with a lot to learn. But I want to do it because I want to change my profile. My background is data warehouse development, data modeling, and ETL development. Here I want to pivot instead of diving deeper into AWS or Azure cloud; I want to learn SAP, maybe SAP BTP and Cloud.

What do you think? Are these good topics for the future and with my background? Is there anyone here who can offer advice on which courses and trainings to start with for an introduction?

entry.title: SAP, AI, and Cloud: A New Era of Enterprise Systems
entry.content:
SAP Today: A Technical Perspective

When we talk about SAP today, it‚Äôs no longer just about ERP. The platform now integrates with AI, machine learning, and cloud technologies. For example, SAP S/4HANA supports real-time analytics. Instead of waiting hours for batch reports, finance and operations teams can work with live data and speed up decision-making.

Integration is another key area. Many organizations run multiple systems: CRM, HR, supply chain, and more. SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) provides a framework that lets these systems communicate. That reduces data duplication, cuts manual steps, and gives more reliable outcomes.

There is also a notable shift toward sustainability and compliance. SAP includes capabilities to track carbon footprints, manage ESG data, and meet global reporting standards. This is now a requirement in many industries, and the platform provides tools to handle the related complexity.

From a technical view, the migration path is important. Moving from ECC to S/4HANA is not just a technical upgrade it requires rethinking processes. Many organizations use the migration to automate workflows, add predictive analytics, or connect IoT devices to ERP. It is as much transformation as it is technology.

In short, SAP is evolving beyond an ERP backbone into a digital core covering analytics, integration, compliance, and automation. The convergence of SAP with AI and cloud-native apps will continue to deepen this role.

entry.title: Connection Issue Between SAP BTP Trial and S/4HANA On-Premise via Cloud Connector
entry.content:
Hi All,

I‚Äôm currently configuring the connectivity between our SAP BTP free trial account and our S/4HANA on-premise system using the Cloud Connector. After completing the setup, I tried to validate the connection between the cloud and on-premise systems, but I encountered an error.

Upon checking the related SAP Note, it seems that the issue might be due to a possible spelling mistake in the host name or a connectivity issue with the internal host.

I have verified that the internal hostname and port are correct, and I also checked in SICF in on-premise system to ensure the correct internal host and port are maintained. However, the connection is still not working. I‚Äôm using an HTTPS connection.

Could you please help me resolve this issue?

BR/Kannan.

entry.title: BTP trial account
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I want to share my strong disappointment regarding the recent changes to the SAP BTP Free Tier/Trial accounts. These restrictions are making it very difficult for new developers and learners to use the platform.

 

1. The Deployment Block

 

The biggest issue is stopping the deployment of apps in BTP for free.

  • BTP is a platform for running apps. If we can't deploy our prototypes and completed tutorials, we can't truly learn how the platform works end-to-end.

  • This is a major setback for anyone trying to get hands-on experience and makes BTP far less accessible for the community.

 

2. Request to Restore Memory

 

I also want to request a return to the older, more generous limits:

  • Please restore the allowed memory limit to 4GB. The current reduced memory quota is too small for many real-world development examples and makes the platform feel unusable for meaningful learning.

I urge the SAP BTP team to reconsider these decisions.

A truly usable free tier is an investment in the future of the BTP developer community. Please restore the ability to deploy applications and give us back the 4GB of memory.

Thank you for listening.

entry.title: Issue with CDS Join for SD & FI Documents for Custom IRN RAP Application
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I am working on a custom RAP based Fiori Elements Application for IRN and E-Way Bill Generation. Currently, we generate the IRN using the SD Document Type based on the CDS view I_BillingDocumentBasic.

As per the new requirement, we also need to include FI Documents, so we are using the CDS view I_JournalEntryItem. Our objective is to retrieve DG and DR documents using a UNION ALL, but we are facing an issue where some required fields are not appearing. I have attached a Code of the CDS view which we have  Developed.

Could anyone guide us on what might be causing the join issue or how we can achieve this requirement in our custom IRN application?

We have created two CDS views one is a join of the FI and SD document CDS views, and the another is the Backend CDS view used for IRN Generation where we fetch the Document Type.

Please find the attached First CDS view which has Join logic for both the SD and FI Document CDS views.

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Billing and FICO Document Type Join'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define view entity ZI_INV_FI_DOC_JOIN
  as select from I_BillingDocumentBasic     as VBRK

    inner join   I_BillingDocumentItemBasic as VBRP on VBRK.BillingDocument = VBRP.BillingDocument
{
  key VBRK.BillingDocument         as BillingDocument,
  key VBRP.BillingDocumentItem     as BillingDocumentItem,
      VBRK.CompanyCode             as CompanyCode,
      VBRK.BillingDocumentType     as BillingDocumentType,
      VBRK.AccountingExchangeRate  as AccountingExchangeRate,
      VBRK.DocumentReferenceID     as DocumentReferenceID,
      VBRK.BillingDocumentDate     as BillingDocumentDate,
      VBRK.CreationDate            as CreationDate,
      VBRK.PayerParty              as Customer,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
      VBRK.TotalNetAmount          as TotalNetAmount,
      VBRK.TransactionCurrency     as TransactionCurrency,
      VBRP.Plant                   as Plant,
      VBRP.ReferenceSDDocument     as ReferenceSDDocument,
      VBRP.ReferenceSDDocumentItem as ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
      VBRP.Material                as Material,
      @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BillingQuantityUnit'
      VBRP.BillingQuantity         as BillingQuantity,
      VBRP.BillingQuantityUnit     as BillingQuantityUnit,
      VBRP.BaseUnit                as BaseUnit,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
      VBRP.NetAmount               as NetAmount
}
union all select from I_JournalEntry     as BKPF
  inner join          I_JournalEntryItem as ACDOCA on BKPF.AccountingDocument = ACDOCA.AccountingDocument
{
  key BKPF.AccountingDocument                             as BillingDocument,
  key cast(ACDOCA.AccountingDocumentItem as abap.char(6)) as BillingDocumentItem,
      BKPF.CompanyCode                                    as CompanyCode,
      BKPF.AccountingDocumentType                         as BillingDocumentType,
      BKPF.ExchangeRate                                   as AccountingExchangeRate,
      BKPF.DocumentReferenceID                            as DocumentReferenceID,
      BKPF. PostingDate                                   as BillingDocumentDate,
      ACDOCA.CreationDate                                 as CreationDate,
      ACDOCA.Customer                                     as Customer,
      ACDOCA.AmountInTransactionCurrency                  as TotalNetAmount,
      ACDOCA.TransactionCurrency                          as TransactionCurrency,
      ACDOCA.Plant                                        as Plant,
      BKPF.DocumentReferenceID                            as ReferenceSDDocument,
      ACDOCA.SourceReferenceDocumentItem                  as ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
      ACDOCA.Product                                      as Material,
      ACDOCA.Quantity                                     as BillingQuantity,
      ACDOCA.ReferenceQuantityUnit                        as BillingQuantityUnit,
      ACDOCA.BaseUnit                                     as BaseUnit,
      ACDOCA.AmountInTransactionCurrency                  as NetAmount
}

 

Here is the another CDS view where we are using this CDS view in the background for fetching the Document Type of SD & FI.

 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'view entity to pick Invoice number'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define root view entity ZBR_INV_EDOC_PICK
       with parameters
       iv_fkdat : abap.dats
  as select from    ZI_INV_FI_DOC_JOIN            as _VBRK_BKPF

    left outer join I_ProductText                 as MAKT      on MAKT.Product = _VBRK_BKPF.Material
    left outer join I_Plant                       as t001w     on t001w.Plant = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
    inner join      I_Customer                    as KNA1      on KNA1.Customer = _VBRK_BKPF.Customer
  
    inner join      ZR_EDOC_TYPE                  as EIDOCTYPE on  EIDOCTYPE.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
                                                               and EIDOCTYPE.BillingType = _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentType
  
    inner join      I_ProductPlantBasic           as marc      on  marc.Product = _VBRK_BKPF.Material
                                                               and marc.Plant   = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
    inner join      I_CompanyCode                 as t001      on t001.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
    left outer join I_IN_PlantBusinessPlaceDetail as PBplace   on  PBplace.Plant       = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
                                                               and PBplace.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
    left outer join I_IN_BusinessPlaceTaxDetail   as BBRANCH   on  BBRANCH.CompanyCode   = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
                                                               and BBRANCH.BusinessPlace = PBplace.BusinessPlace

  association [0..1] to I_Currency      as _TransactionCurrency on $projection.TransactionCurrency = _TransactionCurrency.Currency
  association [0..1] to I_UnitOfMeasure as _BillingQuantityUnit on $projection.BillingQuantityUnit = _BillingQuantityUnit.UnitOfMeasure
{
  key  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocument,
  key  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentItem,
       _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentType,
       _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate,
       _VBRK_BKPF.DocumentReferenceID,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentDate,
       _VBRK_BKPF.CreationDate,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.TotalNetAmount,
       @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.TransactionCurrency,
       _VBRK_BKPF.Plant,
       _VBRK_BKPF.ReferenceSDDocument,
       _VBRK_BKPF.ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
       _VBRK_BKPF.Material,
       PBplace.BusinessPlace,
       MAKT.ProductName,
       @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BillingQuantityUnit'
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantity,
       @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_BillingQuantityUnit'
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BaseUnit,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount,

       LIKP.DeliveryDocument,
       LIKP.ShipToParty,
       LIKP._ShipToParty.BPCustomerName                                                                                                                                             as LBPCustomerName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty.TaxNumber3                                                                                                                                                 as LTaxNumber3,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.CityName                                                                                                                     as LCityName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.DistrictName                                                                                                                 as LDistrictName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.PostalCode                                                                                                                   as LPostalCode,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetName                                                                                                                   as LCStreetName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                            as LCStreetPrefixName1,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                            as LCStreetPrefixName2,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                            as LCStreetSuffixName1,
       t001w.PlantName,
       t001w.AddressID                                                                                                                                                              as PAddressID,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.AddresseeFullName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.CityName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.DistrictName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.PostalCode,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetPrefixName1,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetPrefixName2,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetSuffixName1,
       BBRANCH.IN_GSTIdentificationNumber,
       KNA1.Customer,
       KNA1.BPCustomerName,
       KNA1.AddressID                                                                                                                                                               as CAddressID,
       KNA1.TaxNumber3                                                                                                                                                              as CTaxNumber3,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.CityName                                                                                                                                  as CCityName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.DistrictName                                                                                                                              as CDistrictName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.PostalCode                                                                                                                                as CPostalCode,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetName                                                                                                                                as CStreetName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                                         as CStreetPrefixName1,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                                         as CStreetPrefixName2,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                                         as CStreetSuffixName1,
       t001.CompanyCodeName,
       t001.AddressID                                                                                                                                                               as CCAddressID,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.CityName                                                                                                                                       as CCCityName,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.PostalCode                                                                                                                                     as CCPostalCode,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetName                                                                                                                                     as CCStreetName,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                                              as CCStreetPrefixName1,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                                              as CCStreetPrefixName2,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                                              as CCStreetSuffixName1,
       BBRANCH.IN_GSTIdentificationNumber                                                                                                                                           as CCGSTIN,
       EIDOCTYPE.BillingType,
       EIDOCTYPE.InvoiceType,
       EIDOCTYPE.IrnDocType,
       EIDOCTYPE.SupplyType,
       EIDOCTYPE.IrnApp,
       EIDOCTYPE.EwbApp,
       EIDOCTYPE.EwbDocType,
       EIDOCTYPE.ProcessType,

       _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate                                                                                                       as exrate,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       cast ( cast (  _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount as abap.dec( 15, 5 ) ) *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate as abap.curr(15,2) )                                                         as taxvalue,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       cast ( cast (  _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount as abap.dec( 15, 5 ) ) *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate / cast( _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantity as abap.dec(13,5) )  as abap.curr(15,2 )) as unitprice,
       marc.ConsumptionTaxCtrlCode,
       case
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'kg'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit  = 'KG'
       then 'KGS'
       when _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ea'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'EA'
       then 'NOS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'pc'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'PC'
         or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'st'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ST'
       then 'PCS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'dr'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'DR'
       then 'DRM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ft2' or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'FT2'
       then 'SQF'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'g'   or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'G'
       then 'GMS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'm2'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'M2'
       then 'SQM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'm3'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'M3'
       then 'CBM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ml'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ML'
       then 'MLT'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'paa' or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'PAA'
       then 'PRS'
       else 'OTH'
       end                                                                                                                                                                          as zunit,
       _TransactionCurrency,
       _BillingQuantityUnit
}
where
  _VBRK_BKPF.CreationDate = $parameters.iv_fkdat

 

Thank you,

entry.title: Mass migration of master data and fixed asset postings
entry.content:
I have a new customer for whom we will implement SAP Public Cloud. Among their data, there are 350,000 fixed assets that need to be migrated, including both master data and postings. The upload files are much larger than the 160 MB limit allowed by the Migration Cockpit. I performed a test load in the starter system with 50,000 assets, and it took 14 hours; for postings, it only allowed me to load 45,000.

Is there any way to migrate all this information through a BAdI or API?

#Cloud #fixedasset #massive #migration

entry.title: Minecraft 1.21.124 Bedrock Edition Android Gesti√≥n de Recursos en la Nube y Latencia S3
entry.content:
Referencia del caso t√©cnico y discusi√≥n original: ***REMOVED BY MODERATION***

Hola comunidad tecnol√≥gica. Mientras investigaba sobre la optimizaci√≥n de entrega de contenido est√°tico para aplicaciones m√≥viles de alto tr√°fico en entornos Android, me encontr√© con un escenario interesante de configuraci√≥n en AWS que podr√≠a ser relevante para quienes gestionamos integraciones h√≠bridas.

El caso de estudio se centra en la distribuci√≥n de paquetes de actualizaci√≥n (espec√≠ficamente identificados como la versi√≥n 1.21.124) y los conflictos que surgen entre las pol√≠ticas de acceso p√∫blico de S3 y la distribuci√≥n de CloudFront.

An√°lisis de la Infraestructura 1.21.124

Al intentar desplegar recursos pesados para clientes Android, la configuraci√≥n presenta desaf√≠os que se asemejan mucho a lo que vemos en SAP BTP cuando gestionamos grandes vol√∫menes de datos no estructurados. He estructurado los puntos clave que se discuten en el enlace superior:

  • Sincronizaci√≥n de Datos: Problemas de latencia al conectar el bucket S3 con la aplicaci√≥n cliente en tiempo real.
  • Permisos de Acceso: Conflictos en las ACL (Listas de Control de Acceso) que bloquean la descarga de archivos esenciales.
  • Optimizaci√≥n de Carga: Necesidad de invalidar la cach√© de CloudFront para asegurar que la versi√≥n 1.21.124 se despliegue correctamente sin errores 403.

Detalles de Configuraci√≥n y Rendimiento

Para mantener la estabilidad del sistema bajo carga, se destacan los siguientes par√°metros t√©cnicos que deben ser revisados:

  1. Validaci√≥n de Origen: Asegurar que el OAI (Origin Access Identity) est√© correctamente vinculado.
  2. Compatibilidad Android: Ajuste de headers HTTP para garantizar que el cliente m√≥vil interprete correctamente los paquetes JSON.
  3. Redundancia: Estrategias para evitar la ca√≠da del servicio durante picos de petici√≥n.

Discusi√≥n

Bas√°ndome en el enlace de AWS compartido al inicio, mi duda para los expertos aqu√≠ es: ¬øC√≥mo manejar√≠an ustedes esta validaci√≥n de seguridad si estos activos est√°ticos estuvieran alojados en un entorno integrado con SAP Document Management Service? ¬øSer√≠a m√°s eficiente mantener la pol√≠tica de bloqueo p√∫blico estricta o utilizar URLs firmadas para este tipo de versiones?

Agradezco sus comentarios sobre esta arquitectura.

entry.title: Custom logic for payment advice to add profit center
entry.content:
We are using custom logic for the profit center population in the payment advice form (business context: FINS_PAYMENT_ADVICE_ITEM, ID: FBL_PAYM_ADV_PRINT_ITEM ). The issue is Profit center of the 1st line is repeated for the all the line in the payment advice.

 

DATA: lv_comp        TYPE c LENGTH 4,
      lv_jou         TYPE c LENGTH 10,
      lv_year        TYPE c LENGTH 4,
      lv_pft_ctr     TYPE i_journalentryitem-profitcenter,
      lv_pft_desc    TYPE i_profitcentertext-profitcentername,
      lc_lang        TYPE c LENGTH 1 VALUE 'E',
      wa_item     LIKE LINE OF paymentpaiditems.

 

LOOP AT paymentpaiditems INTO wa_item.

 

  CLEAR: lv_comp, lv_jou, lv_year, lv_pft_ctr, lv_pft_desc.

 

  lv_comp = wa_item-doc2r+0(4).
  lv_jou  = wa_item-doc2r+4(10).
  lv_year = wa_item-doc2r+14(4).

 

  SELECT SINGLE profitcenter
    INTO @LV_pft_ctr
    FROM i_journalentryitem
    WHERE companycode        = @LV_comp
      AND accountingdocument = @LV_jou
      AND fiscalyear         = @LV_year.

 

  IF lv_pft_ctr IS NOT INITIAL.
    SELECT SINGLE profitcentername
      INTO @LV_pft_desc
      FROM i_profitcentertext
      WHERE profitcenter = @LV_pft_ctr
        AND language     = @LC_lang.
  ENDIF.

 

  payment_advice_item_ext-yy1_pftctrpaymentadvic_avi = lv_pft_desc.

 

ENDLOOP.

entry.title: Unable to purchase any product in SAP Store as partner edge
entry.content:
Dear team, 

We are currently unable to purchase any products as a partner, including Free Tier solutions, we have tried on multiple channels:

1. Purchase via SAP Discovery Center:

Add the product to an 'estimate'>
'Buy now' option>
Redirected to a 'Configure SAP Business Technology Platform', even trough we have an active SAP BTP account with many products, and our contract/license is valid on me.sap.com

2- When we try to purchase an SKU in me.sap:

Partnership>
Test, Demo & Development License>
Order Cloud License>
Select any product>
Buy now>
We get error:

'User (S-user) is NOT assigned to Buyer authorization S4M_BUYLIC. Please contact support. (Code: VAL_0004)'
'We are unable to process your order. Please contact support. (Code: DCPCPS_015)'

We have already opened multiple cases with Discovery Center support. After a delay of approximately five days, the only response received was a request to log in using an S-user with Super Admin role ‚Äî which we already have and are using.

Please clarify the root cause and how this can be resolved.
